title.narrative: 305 COVID - IPS HAVE THE CAPACITY TO STRENGTHEN INFECTION PREVENTION & CONTROL

description.narrative: Governments and partners have increased capacity to provide critical WASH supplies and services and strengthen Infection Prevention and Control in communities and institutions., which contributes to Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Water, Water (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Infants, young children, and caregivers especially the most vulnerable have equitable access to and use sustainable, safe, and affordable WASH services (including in Institutions) across the lifecycle.

sector.narrative: Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - improving services in emergency communities
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
WASH - risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
WASH in emergencies - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) response including menstrual hygiene management
Water sector policy and administrative management
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)
Water supply and sanitation - large systems

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Governments and partners have increased capacity to provide critical WASH supplies and services and strengthen Infection Prevention and Control in communities and institutions.

description.narrative: In quarter two UNICEF continued its response on COVID-19. The Joint Response Plan (JRP) for COVID-19 was finalized under the leadership of WHO with inputs from UNICEF and other development partners. The costed plan included handwashing and hygiene components; and was shared for endorsement with MoHFW. UNICEF played a major role in sourcing and delivering soaps, sanitisers , sanitary pads, masks and disinfectants. They were distributed to quarantine camps and migrants across 10 states benefitting 0.9 million people. Multiple states conducted WASH gap assessment in health care facilities and installed minimum touch handwashing stations. | Status: | As-of Date:
